00017 package WeBWorK::DB::Record::User;
00018 use base WeBWorK::DB::Record;
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::DB::Record::User - represent a record from the user table.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 
00029 BEGIN {
00030     __PACKAGE__->_fields(
00031         user_id       => { type=>"TINYBLOB NOT NULL", key=>1 },
00032         first_name    => { type=>"TEXT" },
00033         last_name     => { type=>"TEXT" },
00034         email_address => { type=>"TEXT" },
00035         student_id    => { type=>"TEXT" },
00036         status        => { type=>"TEXT" },
00037         section       => { type=>"TEXT" },
00038         recitation    => { type=>"TEXT" },
00039         comment       => { type=>"TEXT" },
00040     );
00041 }
00042 
00043 sub full_name {
00044     my ($self) = @_;
00045     
00046     my $first = $self->first_name;
00047     my $last = $self->last_name;
00048     
00049     if (defined $first and $first ne "" and defined $last and $last ne "") {
00050         return "$first $last";
00051     } elsif (defined $first and $first ne "") {
00052         return $first;
00053     } elsif (defined $last and $last ne "") {
00054         return $last;
00055     } else {
00056         return "";
00057     }
00058 }
00059 
00060 # phrase      =  1*word                       ; Sequence of words
00061 # word        =  atom / quoted-string
00062 # atom        =  1*<any CHAR except specials, SPACE and CTLs>
00063 # specials    =  "(" / ")" / "<" / ">" / "@"  ; Must be in quoted-
00064 #             /  "," / ";" / ":" / "\" / <">  ;  string, to use
00065 #             /  "." / "[" / "]"              ;  within a word.
00066 # SPACE       =  <ASCII SP, space>            ; (     40,      32.)
00067 # CTL         =  <any ASCII control           ; (  0- 37,  0.- 31.)
00068 #                 character and DEL>          ; (    177,     127.)
00069 # quoted-string = <"> *(qtext/quoted-pair) <">; Regular qtext or
00070 #                                             ;   quoted chars.
00071 # qtext       =  <any CHAR excepting <">,     ; => may be folded
00072 #                "\" & CR, and including
00073 #                linear-white-space>
00074 # CR          =  <ASCII CR, carriage return>  ; (     15,      13.)
00075 # quoted-pair =  "\" CHAR                     ; may quote any char
00076 
00077 sub rfc822_mailbox {
00078     my ($self) = @_;
00079     
00080     my $full_name = $self->full_name;
00081     my $address = $self->email_address;
00082     
00083     if (defined $address and $address ne "") {
00084         if (defined $full_name and $full_name ne "") {
00085             # see if we need to quote the phrase
00086             # (this regex matches CTL, SPACE, and specials)
00087             if ($full_name =~ /[\0-\037\177 ()<>@,;:\\".\[\]]/) {
00088                 $full_name =~ s/(["\\\r])/\\$1/g; # escape <">, "\", or CR
00089                 $full_name = "\"$full_name\"";
00090             }
00091             return "$full_name <$address>";
00092         } else {
00093             return $address;
00094         }
00095     } else {
00096         return "";
00097     }
00098 }
